Package me.talkcode.acc.core.bookkeeping.model

Interface Account

All Superinterfaces:
LedgerRecord
public interface Account extends LedgerRecord
A record in the accounting system that tracks the financial activities of one or more asset, liability, equity, revenue, or expense. An account may have children and whenever it has children you cannot perform debits nor credits directly on it. Whenever an account has children, the balance it shows is sum of the balance of all it's children. Whenever an account is sealed, you can no longer add child accounts to it.

  • Method Details

    • getNature

      AccountNature getNature()
      Gets the nature of the account.
      Returns:

    • postEntry

      AccountEntry postEntry(Ledger.EntryType type, Amount amount, LocalDate date) throws AccountingViolationException
      Posts an entry into the account.
      Parameters:
      type - the Ledger.EntryType
      amount - the amount of the entry
      date - the balance date
      Returns:
      the posted AccountEntry.
      Throws:
      AccountingViolationException - when trying to perform a post onto an Account that has child Accounts. Posts may only be performed on accounts without children

    • getBalance

      Amount getBalance()
      Gets the account's balance.
      Returns:
      the account's own balance in case it has no children, otherwise it returns the sum of the balance of all children.

    • seal

      void seal()
      Blocks any further attemps of adding children accounts.

    • isSealed

      boolean isSealed()
      Tells whether the account is selead or not.
      Returns:
      true if the account is sealed, false otherwise.

    • addChild

      Account addChild(String id, String name) throws SealedAccountException, DuplicateAccountException
      Adds a child account. The account will have the same nature and category of the parent account.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the account.
      name - the name to be assigned to be account.
      Returns:
      the instance of the newly created account.
      Throws:
      SealedAccountException - when attempting to add a child account after sealing the account.
      DuplicateAccountException - when attempting to add a child account with an ID that is already being used by another account.

    • hasChildren

      boolean hasChildren()
      Checks whether account has any children accounts.
      Returns:
      true if the account has at least one child, false if doesn't have any.

    • getChildrenCount

      long getChildrenCount()
      Gets the count of child accounts.
      Returns:
      the total count of child accounts that this account has. The number doesn't include the children of the child accounts.

    • children

      Optional<me.talkcode.commons.query.Queryable<Account>> children()
      Gets a Queryable instance to query children accounts
      Returns:
      a Queryable instance if the account has children

    • entries

      me.talkcode.commons.query.Queryable<AccountEntry> entries()
      Gets a Queryable instance to query entries
      Returns:
      a Queryable instance
